title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 § 349.5 - Emancipated minor
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 § 349.5 - Emancipated minor

State Regulations

Additional statutory authority: Social Services Law, §§
20, 34, 320; L. 1971, ch. 110, § 83
(a) A grant of public assistance or care may
be made to an emancipated minor in his own right if he is otherwise eligible. For this purpose, emancipated minor
means a person over 16
years of age who has completed his compulsory education, who is living separate
and apart from his family and is not in receipt of or in need of foster
care. (b) This section shall not
prevent the department from promulgating regulations authorizing direct grants
of assistance to be made to minors under other circumstances in the ADC
program. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
§
349.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
